data: Instruct patient to call physician or hospital immediately if any of the following occur
Refer to Policy: External Cephalic Version: Procedure for Admission and Care
q15min, during External Cephalic Version procedure and up to 30 minutes post-procedure
Notify relevant obstetrician and OB resident-on-call of patient's admission and to confirm breech position
Refer to Nitroglycerin Administration Short-Term Uterine Relaxation Procedure

Initiate IV sodium chloride 0.9% for the following situations:
- Morbid obesity: body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to 40
- Previous Cesarean section or previous uterine surgery
500 mL, IV, once, drug form: bag
Refer to Procedure: Nitroglycerin: Administration Short-Term Uterine Relaxation
50 mcg, IV, as directed, PRN other (see comment),  drug form: inj
1 spray, sublingual, q5min, duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: spray
2 spray, sublingual, q5min, duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: spray

For BC Women's location only: the US OB External Cephalic Version Only orderable below pertains to orders required for inpatients only. Advanced ordering of the ultrasound has already been done and arranged prior to initiation of this PowerPlan
US OB External Cephalic Version Only
Routine, Notes to scheduler: to be done during external cephalic version procedure
Nurse to notify ultrasound department when patient is ready for External Cephalic Version procedure
